resources.string:
With AnkiDroid, you can efficiently learn large amounts of vocabulary or any other material. AnkiDroid shows you the things to learn just before you forget them.

To get a first impression of how everything works, we recommend to start with a tutorial deck, which will give you some initial information, and try a bit out. Just touch "Study" after having opened it.

Create the tutorial deck now?
This may take a long time
Database checked and optimized.\nShrunk by %d kB.
Send all cards in %s back to their original decks?

string-array.name: about_content
string-array.item:
%1$s:
Flashcards for Android

AnkiDroid is a flashcard application which is fully compatible with the desktop software Anki. You can create, download and learn contents on both, AnkiDroid or Anki Desktop, and synchronize them very easily.
To help us make AnkiDroid better, please report any bug here; new feature ideas are very welcome too! Use the wiki and say Hi on the forum.
AnkiDroid is open source software, so everyone is encouraged to join the contributors:-)
Non-developers can also help, for instance by translating AnkiDroid, updating the wiki and screenshots, donating to Anki Desktop, or blogging about AnkiDroid!
AnkiDroid is released under the GNU-GPL v3 license and the source code is available here.

resources.string: A new version of AnkiDroid is available at Google Play.\n\nWould you like to install it?
Don\'t notify me of this update again
All cards of this note will look like new cards.

Writing to the collection failed. The databese could be corrupt or there may not to be enough empty space on disk.

If this happens more often, try checking the database, repairing the collection or restoring it from a backup. Touch 'options' for that.
\Or it could be an AnkiDroid bug as well; please report the error so that we can check this.
Do you really want to try to repair the database?\n\nBefore starting the attempt, a copy will be created in subfolder \'%s\'.
To add cards to AnkiDroid remove all Notepad categories or add one named \'default\'
Increase today\'s new card limit by
Review cards forgotten in last x days:
Select x cards randomly from the deck:
Preview new cards added in the last x days:

Be aware that this will export your current collection to a file called \'%1$s\' and will create a new one from your old anki 1.x files. If desired, you can manually re-import the above apkg file after completing the wizard. Do you really want to continue?

This is a major update to AnkiDroid and the upgrade process will take at least 10–20 minutes.

Do you want to proceed now or later?

More info
Start AnkiDroid again when you have time to upgrade

The recommended upgrade method is to sync with a PC and upgrade with the desktop version of Anki.

There is also an alternative method where you can upgrade over the internet if you don\'t have access to a PC, and your collection isn\'t too big.
You can exit the upgrade wizard without importing your old cards by touching the exit button below.
You can create a new empty collection by touching below
If you want to downgrade back to AnkiDroid 1 read these instructions.
Your old data will not be imported

This upgrade method isn\'t recommended if you used media files, or have a big collection!

Your Anki1 decks will be zipped and uploaded to AnkiWeb, and the converted collection will then be downloaded.

A stable internet connection is required, and there is a 50MB file limit.

Users of Anki Desktop should use the PC based upgrade method.

Do you still want to proceed?

If you currently have an up-to-date version of your AnkiDroid collection in the Anki desktop software, you can upgrade from there and then download your upgraded collection by syncing with AnkiWeb.

Alternatively, you can copy your AnkiDroid collection to your PC using USB, then upgrade the collection and copy back to AnkiDroid.

Please install and start Anki Desktop version 2.0.4 or greater to upgrade your collection, then sync your upgraded collection with AnkiWeb and press the "Download" button.

More detailed information on upgrading using AnkiWeb

Please copy all of your *.anki files (and any *.media folders) from your AnkiDroid folder to your Anki Desktop folder, and then install and start Anki Desktop version 2.0.4 or greater to upgrade your collection.

When the upgrade is completed, export your collection from Anki2 and copy the collection.apkg file to your AnkiDroid folder and press the Import button below.

More detailed information on upgrading using USB.
The size of your Anki1 decks exceeds the 50 MB limit of the server. Try upgrading with a different method.

The upgrade was completed, but there was an error while unpacking the resulting collection. Make sure that you have enough available disk (%1$d MB needed) and try again, or try upgrading with a different method.
Your old collection has been exported, proceeding with the upgrade process.
Error during the export of your old collection. Would you like to continue with the upgrade process anyway? Your old collection will be lost.
Have you upgraded your collection with Anki Desktop 2 and synced with AnkiWeb?

• Unpacking archive %1$s
• Import of notes %2$d%%
• Import of cards %3$d%%
• Cleanup %4$s
Your collection will be replaced with an older copy. Any unsaved progress will be lost.
The folder you specified does not exist, would you like to create it?
